text: I'm setting up a new python environment with ap pyproject.toml file  I copied the fild from another project.  Can you re-initilize it for an empty project please?

set shell := ["bash", "-eu", "-o", "pipefail", "-c"]

# Use the Python version pinned in .python-version for all commands.

# Sanity check that the development environment is set up correctly.
hello-python:
    uv run --python "$(cat .python-version)" -- python -c "print('hello from justfile')"

just hello-python
uv run --python "$(cat .python-version)" -- python -c "print('hello from justfile')"

      The most likely cause of this is that there is no directory that matches the name

      At least one file selection option must be defined
      in the `tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel` table, see:
      https://hatch.pypa.io/latest/config/build/

      As an example, if you intend to ship a directory named `foo` that resides
      within a `src` directory located at the root of your project, you can define
      the following:

      [tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
      packages = ["src/foo"]

error: Recipe `hello-python` failed on line 7 with exit code 1
please review the files in the @planning folder

Okay, so 1) the planning/project-overview.md and the planning/prompts.md files are out of date and need to be updated. The primary source of the project right now is the planning/TODOS.md document.  The big change is that I am no longer using my own prep notes structure and schemas (with distinct Combat/Social/Exploration encounters) but am using one established by Kelsey Dionne of Arcane Library.  Can you compare the details in the todo.md file and revise the planning/project-overview.md and the planning/prompts.md files to align with the todo list?  As per the todo list, order the prompts as epics via the root elments of the todo outline.
The stuff under For V2 in the todos.md file should be it's own epic as it's for teh version 2 of the project.
